# Discrete variables

.pull-left[
```{r fig.height=3.5, fig.width=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_bar(
    mapping = aes(x = class)
  )
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r}
mpg %>% 
  count(class)
```
]

---

# Continuous variables

.pull-left[
```{r fig.width=3.5, fig.height=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_histogram(
    mapping = aes(x = displ),
    binwidth = 0.05
  )
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r fig.width=3.5, fig.height=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_density(
    mapping = aes(x = displ)
  )
```
]

---

# Categorical vs. continuous variables

```{r fig.height=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_density(
    mapping = aes(x = displ, y = ..scaled.., color = class),
  )
```

---

# Categorical vs. continuous variables

```{r fig.height=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_boxplot(
    mapping = aes(x = class, y = displ),
  )
```

---

# Categorical variables

.pull-left[
```{r fig.width = 3.5, fig.height=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_bin2d(
    mapping = aes(x = drv, y = class),
  )
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r}
mpg %>% 
  count(drv, class)
```
]

---

# Continuous variables

```{r  fig.height=3.5}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_jitter(
    mapping = aes(x = hwy, y = cty),
    alpha = 0.3
  )
```

# More transformation

- Grouped `mutate()` and `filter()`, see r4ds 5.7.1
- Scoped functions, see `?scoped`

## Same syntax for working with databases

- *dbplyr* package

# Joins

r4ds, chapter 13

```{r}
library(nycflights13)
flights %>%
  select(year, month, day, carrier) %>%
  left_join(airlines)
```

---

# Nested data frames

r4ds, chapter 25

```{r}
flights %>%
  nest(-month) %>% 
  arrange(month)
```
